metadata.title: CVE-2018-6392 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The filter_slice function in libavfilter/vf_transpose.c in FFmpeg through3.4.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-arrayaccess) via a crafted MP4 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.2-2').
